website_summaries.verdict: A well-padded, executive-style chair that focuses on comfort. Its everyday price makes it the best deal for the money.
pros: Most owners find it extremely comfortable
cons: Unlike some other chairs, the arms cannot be adjusted

customer_reviews.title: "Leather" scrapes away after a couple years.. looks terrible.
customer_reviews.text: All of the "leather" covering has been peeling away.. and been found all around my house. It scrapes away when sitting on it.. I've only had it for 3 years. Chair looks terrible now, having to throw it out.. Just look at the photo. There goes $165? I'd really like a refund Amazon / Boss.
customer_reviews.author: leetice

customer_reviews.title: NO TOOLS makes it so easy.
customer_reviews.text: It arrived without damage. Yeaah!! It only takes about 10 min. to place all the parts together and without tools. It is very comfortable and FAR better than those office supply places junk. Great price too. The knee or really under leg adjust part is ok and you have to adjust via a turn screw type lever below the chair. It can either lean back or lock from doing so with a large pin. Second Boss chair I have bought and they make a really good chair. Best part is NO fricking allen wrench to assemble and then get loose later as they all do.
customer_reviews.author: CatDaddy & Biatch

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: After using it for 2 years, I think I got my money's worth out of it. One side of the wheels have popped off and keeps popping out when I put it back. I've long since removed the caps for the screws as they just keep falling out. I'm ~220 pounds and after daily use the chair is still in good shape. The only wear and tear is some slight tearing on the outside of the arm rest. Every couple months, mainly when it gets warm out, I'll have to spray some wd40 underneath to stop some squeaking. It's still a solid chair but the wheel popping off is making me replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Angel DeLacroix

customer_reviews.title: Good chair...but mine was defective...missing 2 bolts holding the back up...
customer_reviews.text: I would have rated this chair 5 stars...except for the fact that it failed me catastrophically because of incorrect design. Two hex bolts per side of chair back is the intended design (shown by the empty holes on each side)...but only one hex bolt holding each side of the chair back... I'm not a small guy (220#) but I don't abuse my stuff...and normal usage wore this chair out in 10 months...and the bolts holding the back to the arms were the failure point. You guys owe me a chair!
customer_reviews.author: dwhiteside327

customer_reviews.title: Falling Apart...poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrible. From the first month one I have had nothing but problems with this chair. Over the year it has slowly broken to the point where not it's not usable. The chair is my office chair. The hydraulics started going out within the first two months, that I could deal with. Being a small thing, I just left it down. Then the wheels started to creak, eventually one broke, tipping me out of the chair and into the wall. The wheel now is completely unattached, the arm broke when the chair fell over and threw me into the wall, and now the chair is unable to be used. This is not acceptable for an office chair of this caliber.
customer_reviews.author: Author SA Smith

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable and poorly built
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this on March 2, 2013. A few months later I found the seat uncomfortable and contacted the warranty company. They wouldn't do anything but the manufacturer read my review shortly after, contacted me and sent me a replacement seat. Since then I have found the seat really sags in a bowl shape under me making it uncomfortable and hot. I weigh around 175 lbs and am 5'-8' so I'm not overloading it. The seat also wobbles and the casters and other parts squeak. I believe the density and quality of the seat foam padding is not suitable and that is the problem. I've never owned or used an office chair that lasted such a short time.
customer_reviews.author: Coolswede

customer_reviews.title: Good looking chair and quite comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Good looking chair and quite comfortable, easy to assemble. However the leather materials isn't that great. The arm rest already tear and chipping off already. The Tilt Function can be a bit better, sometime it work and sometime it don't. It's a missed and go on this. After awhile, mine sometime doesn't even tilt anymore until I wiggle and turn the knob a bit, but the knob now become loose and just slide back on it on again from regular used. Simply put, it does not work too well.
customer_reviews.author: Sophisicate

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer has Excellent Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: my adult son uses this chair and loves it - comfortable. At one point one of the casters seemed to give way. We looked and it was actually the plastic grip up inside the 5 star base that gave way. I contacted the manufacturer and they sent us a new base with instructions on how to remove the old base. Unfortunately, the old base would not separate so I called the manufacturer again - and they are sending a new gas lift mechanism also. I can remove the old gas lift mechanism with a screw driver and then put on the new gas lift and base! EXCELLENT customer service from the manufacturer!
customer_reviews.author: K. Clevinger

customer_reviews.title: Not a long lasting chair
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chair in 2011 and used it daily until around 2014. In those 3 years the "leather" has worn off -- it is not real leather. In 2014 after part of the arm rest broke I upgraded to a higher quality chair. Giving it 3 stars since it did end up lasting for 3 years but I was hoping for something with a bit higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Chair
customer_reviews.text: I've used it for 5 years. I got a new chair recently so I'm not longer using this one, but this one is still good and hasn't broken down. I've lived in like 5 different apartments so it's been moved around a lot. The leather has been peeling recently but that's what happens when you use it as much as I do.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ogleari

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: I'm purchase this chair 2 years ago. It's held up okay, but the chair is only comfortable if you're lounging in it; if you try to sit up with a proper posture it does not offer very much support. I would rather a chair that allows for proper posture while using a computer. I spent a lot of money hoping that it would get me a comfortable chair that was good for my back, but i was wrong here
customer_reviews.author: Ted Daigrepont

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced, underwhelming
customer_reviews.text: If zero stars was an option that's what I would give this. For 160$+ I believe I should get a chair that is at the very least comfortable and doesn't feel like it's going to fall apart underneath me. This chair does neither. The pole that holds the seat up from the base wobbles slightly, the seat is not anywhere near long enough to fit an adult comfortably without them feeling like they're sliding out and the quality of the material is noticeably low grade. I've seem better chairs at retail stores for half the price. This went directly back in the box and will be returned.
customer_reviews.author: SpinachKiller

customer_reviews.title: A great chair, if you don't mind the one problem.
customer_reviews.text: I love this chair, but it has a problem. After 6 years of use, the covering had peeled away like an onion, leaving little pieces of black material all over my place. But, it is so comfortable, that I had to order it again. The setup is a breeze, no tools needed. Just snap on the wheels, put on the raising chamber, and then slide the seat on. That is it. For me, at this price I don't mind replacing it every few years. Some folks would never consider doing that, but I haven't found a more comfortable chair, so it is worth it to me.
customer_reviews.author: Donald H. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable for long periods
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 3 of these since 2012, I have bought many computer desk chairs and this one is the most comfortable one I have found. For me they seem to last about 2.5 years. With that said I am 250 LBS and just a tad bit overweight. When this one wears out I will probably get my 4th.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: Average and Overrated
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this product is as cheaply made and flimsy as any average office chair. It does not have any better construction and is not worth any price premium. The reputation does not match the quality of the product. I am 6'3", 225. I used this chair for four weeks. In that time, the chair started to lean to the left, creak when using it, and became unstable when using the recliner. This chair was a huge disappointment considering the good reviews and "#1 seller" status it has on this site. I returned it. I need an office chair that won't collapse and fall apart like cheap cardboard. THIS IS NOT THAT CHAIR.
customer_reviews.author: C. Coppola

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: After having this chair for a year and half it has now started to fall apart. The chair started to rip extremely bad right above the right arm rest. I contacted the supplier costumer service which they told me I was 8 days out of warranty and the best option was to buy a whole back rest for $67. This is crazy that a $150 chair is falling apart after a year and half.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely terrible chair. It looked good out to the box
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely terrible chair. It looked good out to the box, but that's where my positive review ends. The chair two and 1/2 months later squeaks anytime I move and it used to allow me to recline, but now is locked up. I would love to return, but I'm past the return period. I really dislike this supremely cheap chair; it's an imposter posing as an executive chair. A total waste of money!!!
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but .......
customer_reviews.text: I love this chair except for one thing, I was just moving around like normal in my home office, reaching for the file drawer when my heel caught on the wheel base and one of the little end covers snapped off!! I am super bummed because the chair is so stylish otherwise and now it's less than perfect. Maybe it's just my OCD that's making me extra annoyed at an accident but to be honest i don't think that should happen in the first place. The base of the chair is likely to occasionally roll into things and it should be sturdy enough not to just snap at the first rough touch.
customer_reviews.author: Mikester

customer_reviews.title: Good chair, fair price, great seller.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this chair almost four months ago as a replacement for my girlfriend's office chair. It's great. She loves it; says it's more comfortable than the chair it replaced. It's held up great, too. I was uncertain how it would do in that regard, because it was damaged in shipping. One of the arms got broken. However, the seller worked with us to get us a replacement at no cost to us.
customer_reviews.author: VoidMaster

customer_reviews.title: Amazing chair and extremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not real leather, but WHO CARES! I had an older, used, similar type chair given to me for free and it had become my favorite thing to sit in, and the only thing I sat in that kept my back from hurting. After a delay in shipping, which Amazon quickly resolved, I received this chair. only thing I can say is AMAZING. It only took me 3 minutes to assemble without using instructions. This chair is COMFORTABLE and well made. I refuse to get up off of it now. Definitely worth the money and even better on my back! Get this chair!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chair lasted 3 1/2 years for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought the chair back in 2014. I'm a bigger guy, 255 lbs. Work from home most days, and also like gaming, so this chair got a lot of use. Just a few minutes ago, I leaned back and the chair broke, haha.... I still think this is a good chair. I'm bigger than most, and it was a good price for how much use I got out of it. Thinking about ordering another one, even though this one broke on me.
customer_reviews.author: P S

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this chair for less then a year. The height adjust cylinder leaks and the chair drops to its lowest setting. The manufacture does not cover this. I have a much cheaper chair at work that I have had for 3 years now without any problems. The chair looks very nice but the quality is poor. I wouldn't recommend buying this at all.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Problematic construction...
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this now for about 4 months. The chair feels great etc. the problem is the way the chair is attached to the wheel base. You see it ships with both parts separate, then you have to sort of shove the extendable stick on the bottom of the seat into a hole in the wheel base. There are no screws or anything, so the attachment is totally unsecured. This means that when you shift your weight around in the seat it literally shifts out of the base, making a a loud breaking/crunching noise each time. I wish I could return it now really.
customer_reviews.author: A. A. Ade

customer_reviews.title: Started squeaking very soon after use.
customer_reviews.text: Within a week the chair would make a noise whenever it was rocked back. WD40 in certain spots helps for a period of time then it comes back. For the price though I kinda knew what I was getting. It's comfortable and the right height for me. I treat it as disposable. The sound is annoying though and had I known that would be an issue so early on I'd have probably done more research.
customer_reviews.author: Jast

customer_reviews.title: Very affordable office chair, very nice warranty service even on chairs over a year old.
customer_reviews.text: Quite a nice chair for the price. This chair replaced a 7 year old sealy posturpedic. it was very easy to setup, comes half assembled in the mail. about a year after I purchased it the star stand on the bottom cracked where the wheel is inserted and rendered the chair useless. I almost threw it out, but then I decided to see if the chair was under some kind of warranty of any kind. I looked up their site on the internet (www.bosschair.com) called the number listed and gave them the model number for the chair, no questions asked they sent me a replacement stand free of charge! boom! chair is back to 100%.
customer_reviews.author: J H

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for a home office
customer_reviews.text: Good chair for the price. We have 2 of these, one is 6 years old and has very little visible wear. I don’t think if you sit on these 8 hours a day 5 days a week they’d be as good but for a home office they fit my tush just fine
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan K.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: After two years this chair is still in great shape. I use it ever day and it looks brand new. The only fault is that it is starting to creak as I come back up from the leaning position. The sound is a little jarring late at night.
customer_reviews.author: spork4beans

customer_reviews.title: Just not that into you, Chair.
customer_reviews.text: I am just not that into it. I know it was put together correctly; as husband is engineer... but this is just not as comfy as I was hoping for at all. and it creaks weirdly a lot!! The "leather" feels cold and thick on legs if you sit on this wearing shorts also. I also miss having a chair being fully adjustable. Just thinking I should have bought the one I could sit in at Office Depot. I *knew* that one was so comfortable & I am realizing it's maybe not one of those thing someone can actually buy online. I was just hoping to get lucky because reviews were decent.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley A.

customer_reviews.title: but there isn't anything I dislike about it either
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent chair for the price. There isn't anything about it that really wows me, but there isn't anything I dislike about it either. It was super-duper easy to assemble. You just have to snap the wheels in, unfold the chair, and put it on top of the piston; that's all there is to it. I will say that it looks really nice in person. The seat cushion is moderately comfortable, it reclines as far as I would want to in an office chair, and it doesn't squeak. The pleather feels cheap. I'm guessing this will last about 3 years before the upholstery starts falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: Internet Chopper

customer_reviews.title: Leather peels away after a few years
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy. leather peels away after a few years. It looks like terrible now. I have never had a leather product that would just disintegrate. Their customer service is none existent. Not worth the money for a product that will only last a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still lasting strong after 6 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair 6 years ago and even though I am large man (6'2" and 300 lbs), it has lasted all this time and I have no complaints about it.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Not a very good product.
customer_reviews.text: The chair itself is very comfortable, however, very badly made. About a week after I received the first chair, the seat got stuck in an "upright" position and will not allow you to lean back. I had to sent it back and Amazon did paid for the returned shipping cost and sent a new chair out. Three days after I received the new chair, the same thing happened. Sending the last chair back was a big hassle as once assembled, the chair can't be unassembled so it would not fit in the original box. You would have to find a new bigger box for the ship it back.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Gale

customer_reviews.title: Beware of the Fake Leather. It's Scarier than Nightmare on Elm Street
customer_reviews.text: A little over two years later, the so-called leather is shedding everywhere. While comfortable, expect to replace it unless you want to vacuum every day. Four years later, flaking everywhere. Like a black snowstorm. Also the little plastic coverups for screws keep falling out. A nightmare. I feel a chimney seep covered in soot.
customer_reviews.author: B. Judell

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy it again or recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Here's the thing. I was excited to get this, seeing all the good reviews. I got it. Looks nice. But started falling apart. Plus, not very comfortable. And the part that locks/unlocks the reclining part won't stay locked. Keeps popping out. Considered returning it. But considering it would have cost a lot to return it, I'll just make the best of it for now. And maybe give it to a friend who needs one, then get a different chair. The lift part never did work. I wish I could take back one of the two stars I originally gave it.
customer_reviews.author: Reagan

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully upholstered Executive chair with LeatherPlus. I feel I have been fooled with material description
customer_reviews.text: For the first time since I have been a prime purchaser in Amazon, I'm really disappointed with one of your products. This Executive Leather Chair is a fake because of the leather cracking. After 18 months the armrest leather started cracking. This is not leather, is cheap plastic or vinyl material. The arm rests are cracking and deteriorating specially in the area were I rest my right elbow when I'm using my computer and the mouse. This was the price I paid for it: Boss Black LeatherPlus Executive Chair Sold by: Amazon.com LLC $155.99 Condition: New
customer_reviews.author: Oscar A. del Barco E

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky sound + fabric fell apart
customer_reviews.text: The chair was great for the first few months, so much so I bought another one for my husband. But the cover fabric started to disintegrate not long after and it now constantly leaves little pieces of black plastics all over the floor. The threads are now showing and it's really uncomfortable and ugly. The base of the chair also makes really loud squeaky noise whenever I move (loud enough that people on the phone can hear it). Overall very poor value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe Wong

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable, Easy Assembly, Great Value
customer_reviews.text: A few purchasers had commented about long term quality, and Im writing this view when I first received the chair. It arrived packaged well and was very simple assembly - 3 minutes, no tools required. It looks good - good finish and quality. Very comfortable. Good back and leg support. Tilts back more than the stated 20%. To get the tilt, make sure the height adjustment lever is pulled out. Would definitely recommend. Note - as stated, review is based on chair at time of purchase, not after longer term use
customer_reviews.author: @benasmith

customer_reviews.title: Improves posture
customer_reviews.text: Before owning this chair I had the cheap 39 dollar computer chair that wobbled if you move your body weight while sitting. That chair gave me noticable back pain from sitting for hours. I have to say after sitting down on this new boss leather chair I feel so relieved. It has LUMBAR support!! It feels so nice and it improves your posture because it forces u to sit in a up-right position rather than slouching your back. The installation was a breeze. Simply pull the top piece of the chair downward and it will snap into the lock behind the seating piece. Then place it on the wheel piece and you are set!
customer_reviews.author: C. B. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Bad: Its lowest height is not low enough. I'm 5'8" and feel like my legs can swing sometimes when this is at its lowest level. Its too high!! I never sat in a chair so high. Arm rests are too low It should go back a lot further. Im not happy with the recline. No one in my house likes this chair Good: Material feels good The arm rest are well padded
customer_reviews.author: Gavin Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Middle of the seat caves inwards (I weigh 160lbs) and is painful to sit on once it does
customer_reviews.text: Cannot sit in this chair for extended periods of time (longer than 2 hours). Middle of the seat caves inwards (I weigh 160lbs) and is painful to sit on once it does. Also, the arm rest has terrible padding. Had to order a separate arm rest padding and attached it via double sided sticky velcro to the arm rests. On the bright side, assembly was extremely easy and the chair itself looks great. If you're looking for a chair to use over extended periods of time, this is not the one.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Kim

customer_reviews.title: Very nice chair for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice chair. First one came broken, notified amazon had a replacement with no problems. Pros: Very comfortable and looks decent. Seems very sturdy. I am a big guy (6'3" at around 230lbs.) and it doesn't groan or squeak at all. Cons: To ship, the back rest is folded down on to the seat. I had to put this in a vice and bend the metal clasp for it to snap into place. The plastic edge pieces on the feet of the chair keep snapping when my shoes clip the edge. These a fairly minor to me. I do enjoy this chair very much.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: I got mine for ~$160 and I'm a happy and comfortable camper
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time buying this chair. It's seriously one of the most comfy desk chairs I've ever had. A few criticisms though: - Can get a bit squeaky after some time. Liberal use of WD40 inside the top of the base takes care of that for a long while. - There's only lean-on or lean-off, no locking the chair at specific angles. I wish it had this ability! - Not worth it at the list price of $360 in my opinion. Pick it up when it's on sale. I got mine for ~$160 and I'm a happy and comfortable camper.
customer_reviews.author: Alex H.

customer_reviews.title: but I feel like I can review this right away
customer_reviews.text: Been sitting in it for 10minutes, but I feel like I can review this right away. This is NOT a gaming chair, or a casual chair. This has a very firm feel to it, makes you sit up right, and does not recline. Pros: The leather, or plether is very nice and feels exquisite. The base seems solid, but is made of plastic (although it is reinforced a bunch of times) it can , and actually is shipped folded in half. Cons: You feel like you're gonna do serious paper work or business negotiations every time you sit down The rod connecting to the base feels a tad wobbly.
customer_reviews.author: Yezhik

customer_reviews.title: Falsely Advertised by Amazon Search
customer_reviews.text: Amazon's search engine falsely advertised this to me as a 500lbs capacity chair when in reality it's a 250lbs capacity chair. I admit I'm somewhat at fault for not looking more closely at the item details, but that kind of filtering failure in the search engine is unforgivable. EDIT: It keeps making these odd, unpleasant-sounding clicks. I want at least a partial refund so that buying an actual heavyweight chair is less of a burden.
customer_reviews.author: ZeldaTheSwordsman

customer_reviews.title: Great chair; come mostly assembled in a rather big box
customer_reviews.text: I like the chair (I'm 230 lbs; this chair's weight limit is 250 lbs). The back doesn't go as far as I'd like, but then I don't need to be that relaxed while working lest I fall asleep. The only "complaint" I had is the chair's back and the arm rests are already assembled in the box. In fact, you don't need any screws or anything to assemble the chair; all you need is to put the pieces together. This is, of course, a plus for anyone not wanting to go through the whole LEGO/IKEA experience. But this causes the box to be rather big. Also, the chair is rather heavy, so you may need two persons to carry it.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Bought this several years ago, and the entire bottom cushion started peeling after 4 years. Pretty low quality, plan on buying a new one every 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Office Chair !!
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for an office chair for your Home Office or Work, this is the one. I received mine yesterday and I carefully took it out of the box (2 minutes) and I proceeded to put it together as advertised with no tools. The assembly process took another 5 minutes maximum !!! And I instantly had a well made, sturdy office chair. Also i'm tall at 6'3 and most of the time the chairs dont go high enough for me so my legs sit correctly (normal sitting position) I love this chair !!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hill

customer_reviews.title: Decent Chair.
customer_reviews.text: For me this chair looks good and has held up decently to light use. I have had it for well over a year now and it still looks like it did when it was new. No extreme mobility for ergonomic comfort that many higher priced chairs have, but well worth it for the price. I use it at my home office about two to three times a week. It is a little loose in the base now, but nothing that has me concerned. It doesn't lean back which is why I think it has stood up for so long.
customer_reviews.author: JD_Walkers

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, supportive chair
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good chair; assembly was pretty easy, and it's very comfy and supportive. I sat in this chair every day for 2 years when I worked at home, and I always liked it. The faux leather feels nice enough. Really like the arm rests. Only two problems: it started to squeak a bit after 2 years (though I suspect I could have fixed this with some well placed WD-40), and the faux leather began to peel a tiny bit on the side of one arm rest (also after 2 years of constant use). Neither one was a big deal; I was still sad to sell it when I moved. Great chair.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Wagener

customer_reviews.title: Quality not very durable
customer_reviews.text: Great service from the seller product delivered on time no issues what so ever. The product it self is not long lasting I think, one of the chairs brooke the handle in shipment and the other I am using are starting to make the queeking sound. I am not happy with the quality of the product. Comfort wise the product is good but durability I am not sure. All the reviews for this are positive expect a few and I am shocked I have to be in thoose few ones but really and truly its making sounds and its bad its hardly 2 months old. Sorry but I do not recommend this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Mehta

customer_reviews.title: Bought this chair in 2012
customer_reviews.text: I've had this chair for 7 years now. I love it. It's comfortable, but now the piston is failing and the chair slowly sinks which is annoying having to raise the seat over and over throughout the day. For how long I've owned the chair, I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Dressel

customer_reviews.title: Holy loud, loud, loud!
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to be too hard on this chair, but it was certainly a disappointing purchase. I should have known to temper my expectations considering the price. The seat cushion is very thin after just one month of use. No big deal, we just place another cushion on top and use it that way. The real issues with this item are the noise and construction. The arms creaking and dropping plastic pieces (turns out they're screw caps)is a small concern compared to how loud the chair is.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Henline

customer_reviews.title: Real junk!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chair it certainly wasn't worth the money. It's nearly 3 years old but the chair was not used daily. Finally today I became so frustrated I ordered a new HON replacement. The cylinder controlling the BOSS chair height always required adjustment sank to floor level. Now it's totally inoperative. The "imitation" leather on the arm rests and seat have been peeling for months just from intermittent use. What an eye sore and sold by Amazon. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: xfmrman

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Chair At A Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with my purchase of this exceptionally comfortable and sturdy chair. Out of necessity, I've purchased many office chairs over the years. It seem no matter how much I spend, I get about 3 years or so out of an office chair before the foam collapses, the leather degrades, or something breaks. On this chair, I particularly like the seating comfort and the lumbar support. The smooth vinyl upholstery surfaces look super and feel great. I've sat in this office chair for many hours thus far and it has become an old familiar friend. I will definitely buy another when that day arrives. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor A.

customer_reviews.title: NOT RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea what they mean by knee tilt. There is no such thing on this chair. The photo shows a round adjustment knob underneath towards the front which does not exist. There is a height adjustment lever and a handle that can be turned tp allows the chair to recline. Thew allows the chair to recline about 30 degrees. I am 6'4" and the chair is reasonably comfortable for a tall person. That being said, I wish that I had bought something else.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H.

customer_reviews.title: Chair is great, I have been using it for about a ...
customer_reviews.text: Chair is great, I have been using it for about a year now and really love it. The only thing that I have take a mark off for is the plastic corners above the wheels get caught on my shoe and I have popped off 3 of the 5. Really doesn't change anything, the chair still feels comfortable, it still rolls around smoothly, and the leather has a nice feel to it. It is the smoother style leather, almost like what you would find in a sporty car. Other than the little plastic pieces, the chair does feel really solid and should last for several more years.
customer_reviews.author: 00AlanJ

customer_reviews.title: This chair is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I use this chair heavily every day. It has no signs of wear after 6+ months, rolls just fine, but does have a slight squeak. the chair is not leather, which is what I thought I wanted. The material is durable and has no rips, marks, or creases so far. The squeak... well, it does have that. I don't know what to do about it, so I just ignore it. I have never had one of these chairs that didn't eventually have one. I am expecting to replace this in about 3+ years, and I will hopefully find one with no squeak.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The seat is very comfortable, but the tension adjustment knob which supposedly allows ...
customer_reviews.text: The seat is very comfortable, but the tension adjustment knob which supposedly allows the chair to tilt does absolutely NOTHING. No matter where it's set, you must sit absolutely straight up, or even hunch forward a bit. NOT soothing or supportive to the back at ALL. Also, there's not room to insert a lumbar support pillow behind oneself unless one wants to scoot halfway forward out of the chair, hanging precariously in midair. Not worth the money, but better than a folding chair with pillows.
customer_reviews.author: Ironlily

customer_reviews.title: It is a very comfortable and good looking chair
customer_reviews.text: It is a very comfortable and good looking chair. It also feels well constructed, however, it is not. I like it enough to have bought a second one after my first broke. The hydraulic lift sprang a leak, replaced the part quickly for $12 from Boss. Then one arm then the other became detached from the plywood back. The first chair lasted for a year. Same problem with the arm on the second chair. The fake leather does not look so good once you start screwing into it. All in all, you get what you pay for. Look and feels good, doesn't but doesn't last. Very close to being a great chair.
customer_reviews.author: MattC

customer_reviews.title: It came in a box and was easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair on October 1, 2014. It came in a box and was easy to setup. The back clip was loose but it held fairly good a a few tie wraps secured it. Flash forward, today December 17, 2014 I noticed the chair is getting 'looser' so I looked closer, the arm rest and the back of the chair unbolted and cannot be tightened without removing the leather. Piece of junk! You get what you pay for, the one I had previously cam from Office Depot and lasted 7 years verses 2.5 months...
customer_reviews.author: Jim Bodden

customer_reviews.title: Soft and Comfortable Chair!
customer_reviews.text: The chair is made of a a very soft material that feels great to the touch. It's rather firm to sit in but I bought it because I need more support at my desk and with the lumbar support this chair is very comfortable to use for long periods of time. It was ridiculously easy to assemble, it comes half put together in the box, just snap a few pieces into place. No tools, no hassle. It feels really sturdy, doesn't rock, wobble, or squeak. I've been using it for about a week now with no complaints! I would definitely recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: M. J.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted about a year or so.
customer_reviews.text: Chair was decent for about a year or so. Then the padding started to compress. Still not that bad, but about 6 months ago it started making a loud clack/thunk sound when reclining or leaning forward. That's the deal breaker. I stay up late at night playing WoW or talking on the ham radio, every time I move in the chair I feel like I'm waking up the household. Off to Costco to buy a decent chair and roll this one to the curb with a "free" sign on it.
customer_reviews.author: zoran888

customer_reviews.title: Loved it at first but I bought it in 2011 ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved it at first but I bought it in 2011 and now it is completely destroyed. The left arm snapped in two separate places (at different times). The faux leather started stripping off in 2016, and then the plastic arms snapped right off. That made the back unusable so this thing is toast. Just bought a different chair.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Flo

customer_reviews.title: Yes!!
customer_reviews.text: First, let me assure you I've paid in past years at least 4 times what this chair costs to get something not as good. This is a very solid, comfortable executive-type chair. If you spend a lot of time in a chair you are going to want this one. Assembly took less that 2 minutes. No tools required. If I had thought it would be that easy I could have done it in less than a minute, say, 30 seconds. It's just that I kept staring at it thinking -- it cannot be this easy! This is a very well built, obviously high quality piece of furniture. Do it!
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Comfy chair, but it squeaks
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice comfy chair. I love sitting in it. I can sit in it for hours. I bought a second one. I might have thought twice about doing so if I knew it squeaks. The squeaks are quite loud and occur if you move a muscle. It can be distracting if you are sitting in the chair while on a conference call or if you make videos from your computer.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: I didn't know chairs could spoil
customer_reviews.text: Not sure exactly when we got these. Maybe 4 or 5 Christmases ago. The chairs are fine, in that they are still chairs, but the cushioning has gone flat and the faux leather is completely deteriorating. Flakes all over the place that stick to clothing and deposit elsewhere. There's no way to mend this and the chairs are embarrassingly hideous undead versions of what they once looked like. Get one at your own discretion but do so knowing that the materials will not last long at all
customer_reviews.author: KCNY

customer_reviews.title: Not like the old one
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of these chairs I have purchased. The first one was great until the "leather plus" began to peel off after about five years. The new chairs seat is pillowed up in the center center making it uncomfortable to sit in. I've had some medical issues to deal with and didn't get around to testing this chair until now. According to Amazon it's too late to return it so I guess I'm stuck. I'm begining to wonder if shopping locally might be a better option for a chair like this.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Colley

customer_reviews.title: Nothing about this chair will last. 2 years in ...
customer_reviews.text: Nothing about this chair will last. 2 years in, it wobbles, the black footrest thingys have all fallen off, now the hydraulic canister thing won't keep the chair up anymore. Dissappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Gabbert

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - This chair is VERY comfortable. - The "pleather" (leather/vinyl hybrid) is pretty decent too. - I'm a heavier guy (250 lbs), and the chair down not slowly drop down or anything, so the pump works good at 250lbs. - Setup: Easy -- the chair is basically assembled and all you have to do is pop the top on the base and snap in the wheels. Cons: - Some people have said it smells sort of weird, the leather/vinyl hybrid, and I can verify this, although it goes away after you sit in the chair, so it's not really a big deal. - The arm rests are a tad low, but still work.
customer_reviews.author: N. George

customer_reviews.title: Fake leather sheds like black dandruff
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have stated... Good looks and comfort do not last. I bought mine 4+ years ago, but it started deteriorating more than a year ago. I just can't put up with it any longer and will look for a replacement. The "leather" appears to be sprayed on and with rubbing over time comes off as seen in the attached photo. I'm disappointed the chair did not hold up and would not recommend anyone buy this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Bob in Jupiter

customer_reviews.title: Less than 2 years old completely blown apart
customer_reviews.text: If you purchase this chair you should consider the extended warranty. It is less than 2 years old and I was leaning back in the chair and it broke and is completely destroyed. Even if I thought it was comfortable it couldn't make it 2 years. I am 5'10" tall and weigh 175 lbs. this should not have happened. If you purchase this chair. Good Luck
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Great for My Home Office
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my home office ~3 months ago. It shipped and arrived right on time, as usual. It arrived undamaged and was easy to unpack, but the BIG PLUS was how EASY THIS THING WAS TO ASSEMBLE! I mean this thing just pops right together in under 5 minutes. I don't use this chair nearly as often as my normal office chair, but I have spent some power sessions in it at home (8-10 hours of hardcore excel building) and I have never been uncomfortable. I am impressed thus far.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wells

customer_reviews.title: This chair will be useless after one year
customer_reviews.text: This chair was used by a nerdy, well behaved 12 year old child. The back of this chair has broken after one year. The chair squeaks and needs oiling once per month. But it was comfortable for the first six months.
customer_reviews.author: bayleaves

customer_reviews.title: I love the fact it makes you sit up very straight
customer_reviews.text: I go through alot of chairs because i am at them almost 11 or 12 hours a day working. This chair is possibly one of my favorites over the years. I love the fact it makes you sit up very straight. With my back problems the chairs that lean back or cradle you i have noticed i have to lean forward to get to my keyboard or desk alot which contradicts the reason for having a high back chair, lol. It does lean back if you want to relax as well. Was incredibly easy to put together, no tools required at all. Great chair, i will buy it again when this ones goes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I spent all that money and it is not a good fit.
customer_reviews.text: the chair is well built but it didn't say in the advertisement that is was for a big person and I am a small person.. I spent all that money and it is not a good fit.. very disappointed as I am stuck with it. and I am a low income person. so this set me back financially I also have back problems so I have to put pillows in back of me and still it is not comfortable. I use a lap top10 hours a day. not good.
customer_reviews.author: adrienne j venditti

customer_reviews.title: I like this chair and have had it for about a ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this chair and have had it for about a year and a half. It's comfortable and looks nice. Two things I don't love is that where it is pressed against the desk (where the arms sit) the material has cracked and frayed. Also, the chair sometimes sinks down while you're sitting in it. My husband and I are no where near the weight limit so that is a little disappointing. Overall though, for the price point it is a pretty solid chair.
customer_reviews.author: SAS_CJK

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: It was fine for the first 3 years. Some of the plastic screw covers popped off shortly after we got it but it functioned well. That is until these last few years, the material is literally falling apart. Give it maybe 4 years then it will be trash.
customer_reviews.author: Yewpendi

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy
customer_reviews.text: I used to use this for my desk, but now that I no longer have a desk I just use it while playing video games. Hours of comfort and my butt doesn't hurt when I got to stand up. Reclines nice and supports me just fine. I'm 6'2, 210lbs. I would have given this four stars is the setup of the chair was easier and this one small capsule/cover piece of my chair didn't keep falling off.
customer_reviews.author: Clutch

customer_reviews.title: This item is not easy to put together as stated
customer_reviews.text: This item is not easy to put together as stated. I had a problem with the wheels, putting them on. I needed help from others to put it together from 2 people. The chair I nice to sit on until the wheels2 of the wheels fell off. I am not happy ay this point. The chair is comfortable to sit on once it is put together. And the directions are not easy understand if there are even any, there is just a picture which I didn't even understand so I was a little unhappy with this chair. I am happy now which it is put together.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Olson

customer_reviews.title: This is the best office chair I've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: Arrival: Chair came well packed (I mean really well packed with foam padding) Setup: Chair was put together in 10 minutes with no tools. The chair is heavy though so a little strength is required. Use: This is the best office chair I've ever had. It's really comfortable because of how strong and sturdy it is. The material is soft and luxurious. It moves very easily even on carpeted floors (I don't have a carpet protector yet). I am 5'8" and the height of the chair is perfect. Loving the lumbar support as well. Recommend? Definitely.
customer_reviews.author: Wen

customer_reviews.title: PCARP - Powerhouse chair at a resonable price
customer_reviews.text: This chair is incredibly comfortable. I have had all sorts of back issues and I have found this chair to be one of the most comfortable of the chairs I have used for work. I had one of those expensive ergonomic chairs at my old work place and had consistent and sometimes debilitating back pain. This one has been a life saver. And its at a resonable price!!
customer_reviews.author: MJB

customer_reviews.title: Also very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this chair for a three years now, spending anywhere from 5-15 hours a day on it and it's still holding up well. There's a few creaks here and there but no real issue. The fabric on the arms is noticeably worn if you inspect it but at the end of the day it's highly satisfactory. Not going to last you your whole life but you get what you pay for. Definitely appears more expensive than it is. Also very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Cade

customer_reviews.title: Unbearable discomfort
customer_reviews.text: This chair is very uncomfortable. It took me forever to find something that would even make it bearable to sit in all day and finally I found something that cost me $50. I have no idea why the seat is so hard, but it is and it makes my tailbone hurt so much I can hardly last all day in it. Do yourself a favor and buy another chair - not this one!
customer_reviews.author: English Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Office Chair
customer_reviews.text: This chair is high quality, comfortable - and easy to assemble. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Faux leather peels off after a few years
customer_reviews.text: I love this chair but unfortunately the faux leather is peeling off on the arm rests and the seat, making it messy with black flakes everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: An ok chair but i have to remove stars because ...
customer_reviews.text: An ok chair but i have to remove stars because of the leather cracking. After 1 year the armrest leather started cracking and after 2 years it happening all around. Next time i will be looking at other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Florin

customer_reviews.title: I really like this chair
customer_reviews.text: I really like this chair. I've had it for a few years now and it still holds up. It's solid, especially for the price. It's also pretty comfortable. If you aren't a boss I think you'd still enjoy it. Feel like a boss at home, nobody will mind.
customer_reviews.author: James T.

customer_reviews.title: Okay Chair, Terrible Shipping
customer_reviews.text: I like the material and the seat height of the seat. I wish I could adjust the back of the chair to come forward some for better back support while working. I had a very difficult time receiving the chair from the shipper. When it was first delivered, the box was ragged and all of the chair parts were not available. It took another week to redeliver. I ended up having to go to one of the shipper's locations on a dark rainy night to pick it up. It was truly a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Tugg

customer_reviews.title: You need a chair that makes you sit correctly, with you back straight, otherwise you develop lower back problems
customer_reviews.text: I have used it for 4 months. I wish I had bought it earlier. The old chair was affecting my back. I researched this chair before (buying it in Amazon) as recommended for gamers and other people that spend too many hours sitting by the computer. You need a chair that makes you sit correctly, with you back straight, otherwise you develop lower back problems.
customer_reviews.author: Douwd

customer_reviews.title: Comfy Chair for the Tall!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chair for my husband whose job and hobby requires a comfortable, sturdy chair for tall people. He loves the chair and bought a second to use when he has to work at the office. So, far it still has the original padding (even on the butt cushion) and the padding on the arms has not scuffed or frayed. I wish I could by one for myself but at 5'2" I am too short to fit :( TLDR: Such an awesome chair - we bought 2!
customer_reviews.author: learn4life

customer_reviews.title: the seat of this chair may be too high for you to be comfortable. Otherwise it appears to be a well made ...
customer_reviews.text: The Chair is taller than I expected. If you are a person of small stature, the seat of this chair may be too high for you to be comfortable. Otherwise it appears to be a well made and sturdy chair. Time will tell. There is one issue that my be very important for some people: there were NO assembly instructions included. For me, it was a relatively simple assembly as I have assembled office chairs before. This may not be the case for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Semi comfy, quality is horrible.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what the bottom layer of this chair is made of but it's a very thin leather / pleather material. I've had the chair for a year now and that bottom part has managed to crack and tear apart on its own. I'm 5' 10" 148 lbs, and this chair fits me perfectly. The seat is fairly comfortable but the side arms and the bottom stand are all made of some sort of plastic. Very easily scratchable. For this price I would've expected a longer lasting chair. Lets see if this can last another year...
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: This chair saved my marriage.
customer_reviews.text: This chair saved my marriage! ...okay that's a lie but I can now sit and work for hours without getting pains and an irritable attitude. I can work a ten hour day as a designer or watch a movie marathon in comfort. I have nothing bad to say about this chair!!! I've had mine for maybe a year. It shows no sign of wear. Don't hesitate to get this model.
customer_reviews.author: Lee M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair. Looks expensive
customer_reviews.text: Nice chair. Looks expensive. Leather is very high quality, reminds be of BMW leather - very fine grain, and thick. Some may find it a bit stiff. Assembled super quick with no tools or extra fasteners. The one minor issue is that the plastic screw head plugs tend to fall out. A good choice for a higher end office chair.
customer_reviews.author: Fresh Aire

customer_reviews.title: This chair has proven to be EXCELLENT! My husband spends upwards of 8 hrs on ...
customer_reviews.text: This chair has proven to be EXCELLENT! My husband spends upwards of 8 hrs on some days, and has found that it is still comfortable at the end of the day! I would definitely recommend this chair and the company. It has been perfect and the company very easy to work with. I would definitely buy this product again when I need another one (but this one is holding up so well it may be a while :) )
customer_reviews.author: Happy baker

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Chair. Could be a little shorter.
customer_reviews.text: The chair is nice and firm. It has more than enough cushioning to the seat and backrest to make it the most comfortable chair I own. The only thing that would make it better is if it could go down a few more inches. I have never owned an office chair that wouldn't go to the floor. This one will not and to get the benefit of the lumbar support you have to sit back all the way against the back of the chair. In my Opinion it might be uncomfortable to anyone shorter than about 5'8".
customer_reviews.author: Harmon

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE my chair
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my chair. I bought it when I purchased my last iMac, and it was a great choice (and a definite upgrade from the weird IKEA bowl-shaped chair it was replacing). I have back issues, so the support offered by this chair is fantastic. I rarely find myself in pain after a long session in front of the computer, which was my main complaint about my last chair. Easy to adjust, easy to assemble, and it looks nice. The only suggestion I have is to consider purchasing a memory foam pad for your bum, as it means even less pressure in your spine.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Easy to Assemble.
customer_reviews.text: I was so glad to finally buy another Computer chair.After sitting on a uncomfortable Kitchen chair.Money well spent built to last.Assembly in less than 20 minutes that including taking it out the box.No tools needed just put in together.And it's comfortable nice soft leather comfort.It recline a little to.But don't over do it.This is not a liver room recliner.Highly recommended.Your back will love you for it.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Pretlow

customer_reviews.title: A decent chair, and med quality cover that should last at least 3 years use.
customer_reviews.text: Well put together, easy to assemble, the leather is much higher quality than chairs of a cheaper nature. I expect this one to last much longer than the one that was purchased last year at half the price, which is already cracking. The only minor frustration is that the chair creeks if weight is shifted side to side.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but cheap parts.
customer_reviews.text: I love sitting in this chair but the parts on it just don't seem to hold up. I've had this chair for about six months and the left arm will slip down out of place because a bolt or something doesn't stay on. and the other day i was leaning back in the chair and where you snap in the wheel to one of the five parts a small part of the circle you put it in snapped and now the wheel won't go in it. I looked for a replacement bottom and have yet to find one..
customer_reviews.author: Brock

product_meta.title: Boss Office Products High Back No Tools Required LeatherPlus Chair in Black
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:High Back ChairThe Boss "NTR" Executive LeatherPlus Chair by Boss Office Products requires so little assembly that you'll literally have it put together within minutes of removing it from the box. The chair is soft to the touch thanks to the polyurethane infused leather, which also offers durability. The back features an ergonomic curve for proper lumbar support as well as a waterfall seat that keeps legs from becoming too tired. Measurements for the unit are 27" W x 28" D x 45-48.5" H with the height being determined by the user via the pneumatic gas lift. Additional features include an adjustable tilt tension and the ability to lock the chair in an upright position.
feature_bullets: NTR- No tools required for assembly
Beautifully upholstered with LeatherPlus (leather that is polyurethane infused for added softness and durability)
Waterfall seat design eliminates leg fatigue; Ergonomic back design with lumbar support
Upright locking position; Adjustable tilt tension. Optional knee-tilt mechanism

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.5 out of 5 stars1,496 ratings3.5 out of 5 stars
